brief_summary.textblock:
Liver biopsy for the assessment of fibrosis has multiple limitations.  Liver ShearWaveTM
      Elastography may provide a non-invasive, fast, and reproducible alternative for the
      quantitative assessment of liver fibrosis.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quantitative Evaluation of the Progression of Liver Disease, Using ShearWaveTM

detailed_description.textblock:
To obtain a quantitative evaluation of the progression of liver disease, using ShearWaveTM
      Elastography measurements obtained with the Supersonic Imagine Aixplorer ultrasound machine.

      To compare the glomerular filtration rate and the quantitative evaluation of the progression
      of renal disease, using ShearWaveTM Elastography measurements obtained with the Supersonic
      Imagine Aixplorer ultrasound machine in post-liver transplantation patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Males and Females over the age of 18

          -  Patients of LCOT Dallas office, with chronic liver disease

          -  Liver Transplant Recipients

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Any person unable to provide an informed consent

          -  Any female who is pregnant or thinks she might be pregnant

study_pop.textblock: participants will be from Liver Consultants of Texas patient population

clinical_study.official_title: Quantitative Evaluation of Liver and Kidney Disease With Liver and Kidney Elastography Measurements in Liver Transplant Recipients Using the Supersonic Imagine Aixplorer ShearWaveTM Elastography Ultrasound Machine

primary_outcome.description: Patients will have a scan performed at thier regularly scheduled clinic visits.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
